Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: millie117
Reviews.Content: The staff were polite, attentive and friendly and let us join in their lively discussions!.The ambience of the place is old fashioned (in a good way) and comfortable. Many of the other guests had stayed before. Wine and cheese early evening in the little sitting room was much appreciated. Breakfast was adequate, Hotel perfectly located for us, near museums with easy access to subway. After reading the reviews I was worried that the room would be tiny, but in fact it was fine The bathroom was minute, with the handbasin in the bedroom. All very clean, nicely furnished, comfortable bed, quiet room. The TV picture was fuzzy so didn't use it.. We booked the hotel's car to take us to the airport - so easy. Would definitely recommend The Franklin and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JT H
Reviews.Content: Loved how quaint and luxorious this hotel was. Free esspresso machine access, and wine happy hour each evening was a great amenity. Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. Great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms? Not for NYC”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenBella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Franklin in June 2011 and loved it. I've been to New York City before but stayed at a big hotel back then, so I enjoyed the 'smaller' and warmer feeling that surrounded the hotel. Some people complain about the rooms being small. Come on, it's NYC. The Franklin rooms arent' small, the beeds are just big(!) and so good, I almost wanted to stay in them all day. Nice personal, clean rooms, absolutely no noise from outside. No complains!

Reviews.Title: “Bring back the old Franklin!”
Reviews.Author: Oloud
Reviews.Content: This place has gone down hill. I'm wondering if management has changed. Namely, the quality of the continental breakfast went from excellent to poor. A few years ago they offered a gourmet cheese tray, fresh plain yogurt, homemade granola; think European and healthy. This time I was shocked and disappointed to find a chain-hotel-grade pastry tray, processed cereals and cheeses, yogurt with aspartame, and nutri grain bars (is this 1996?). Calming jazz music has been replaced with awful contemporary pop. I never minded the small rooms, but the furnishings especially in the common room are now tattered. It's no longer special, there's no style left. There are better boutique hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “EVEN EXEC KING CRAMPED & UNCOMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: Ann608
Reviews.Content: We knew the rooms at the Franklin were small so we opted for the exec king, but the bed took up 2/3 of the room so it was STILL cramped. It wasn't even possible to open the closest door all the way because the nightstand was in the way. There's not a drawer to be found. You have to live out of your suitcase. The bathroom is so inconvenient that I had to put my makeup kit on the back of the toilet when getting dressed in the morning because there was nowhere else for it! The entrance to the hotel is depressing: no lobby, just two dingy little rooms in the back for breakfast and wine. They say both are complimentary but there is a service charge. For what I ask? We learned our lesson. In NYC there are no bargains.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Visit Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly2470
Reviews.Content: The Franklin Hotel was the perfect place to spend our 1 yr Anniversary. It's romantic and charming with it's Art Deco feel. The staff were awesome, friendly and helpful when needed. We loved the 5pm wine and cheese and the coffee/breakfast every morning. Everything is assessable in the neighborhood...We will definitely stay here next time...hopefully, soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Good localization and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: flaces
Reviews.Content: Although it is uptown, the hotel is near from metro station, so it's easy to go everywhere. Good restaurants nearby if you don't want go far. Staff was very nice and neighborhood was quiet. Just a walk from the Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short stay.”
Reviews.Author: NyThyme
Reviews.Content: Upper East Side hotels are dwindling and The Franklin is probably the best value of any of those that remain. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. The staff is very helpful. Continental breakfast is included, coffee is always available (good coffee) and nice snacks are offered in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. The room was comfortable but too small. Continental breakfast. Friendly staff. The hotel was clean. I recomended it my friends

Reviews.Title: “Utterly delightful”
Reviews.Author: tonymsrad
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel. Friendly staff. Room small but immaculate. For the price, and for a lot more, you can't beat this hotel. No reason to stay elsewhere unless you want a guy with a waistcoat unloading your luggage, or some guy with a tip jar playing a piano. Really, really pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “There is no better value in NYC, great staff, superb location, small but clean, modern, well appointed rooms with good cotton an”
Reviews.Author: UKBoyDKGirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in NYC every year since 1998 and this hotel is by far the best value I have come across. Dont stay for room service or rambling suites because they aint here, stay because it is Upper East Side, bang next to Madison Ave shops, museums and Central Park. Staff helped us with ice hockey tickets and delivery restaurants and were there for us 24/7. And $112 a night booked via their website? Please. NB We didnt use the window mounted AC.

Reviews.Title: “The Franklin is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTraveling109
Reviews.Content: I travel with oxygen. I emailed the manager two weeks prior to our arrival and he recommended a local DME to provide supplemental oxygen. It worked out flawlessly, thanks. Upon our arrival at around 9:00 am we were way to early to check in. The bellman secured our bags for us and we had breakfast at the hotel. We then made our first foray into the city. As this was our first time in the city we of course were in awe of it all. We went straight away to shop, around noon my batteries ran out on my oxygen concentrator so back to the hotel by taxi. We settled in to the parlor at the Franklin to recharge my battery when the bellman told us our room was ready(three hours early). We stayed in room 91, a large room with a large King Size Bed that was to die for. The Bed and Bedding were wonderful. The room was clean. The bathroom was full sized with a great Hot Shower. At every turn the staff went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating. Several times we asked for a car service to go to various places. The cars were always on time with friendly NON-aggressive drivers. One time the car service sent a limo to pick us up for diner which made me a hero. I will stay here again and recommend this Hotel to everyone. Thank you Hotel Franklin for a wonderful stay, you made my wife's dream trip truly a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Small but Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: PAM_from_LINY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel mid December for one night. Upon arrival, I think I walked into a chaotic staff moment; The front desk attendant was speaking very loudly at another staffer and I had to wait until things settled down. I was early for the room (2:15 for a 3pm check in) and I was told the room was not ready but I could use the bathroom and wait in the lounge. The latter was tiny with no water or cheer (like flowers which are in some of the Tripadvisor photos). Another customer joined me as we both waited. The room was quite clean and nicely appointed with pleasantly scented soap, shampoo etc. Although on the small side, it was more than adequate and the bed/pillows were super comfortable. The TV remote didn't work which was annoying but no complaints. After I checked out, I realized that the hotel offers breakfast buffet and wine and cheese. I returned to the hotel room one night and the cardkey to the door had been deactivated. The staffer did not think this was unusual at all, but it was inconvenient given the long day I'd had and the fact that my feet were sore. The Front Desk attendant never bothered to describe the amenities offered which was a shame. The staff is friendly almost to the point of being casual. An earlier review mentioned a helpful staffer opening the elevator door for them; No one did this during my stay, in fact, the front desk guy and the lobby attendant who were sitting side by side at the counter only 4 feet from the elevator merely pointed and told me to pull on the door. In checking prices of boutique hotels in Manhattan there appear to be many other hotels with similar amenities and prices. I will check out other places on future trips but would also return to the Franklin.

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely, boutique hotel in a nice neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: merylsimon
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a last minute stay on Thanksgiving weekend, knowing nothing about the hotel. We chose it for the upper east side neighborhood. We were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in an older hotel in NYC. The hotel has been updated and the furnishings were clean and modern. The lobby has a lovely, small breakfast room and sitting room. A continental breakfast was included. It feels very European. Location is walk able to Central Park, museums and 2 blocks from the subway. Great residential neighborhood with lots of restaurants, coffee shops, everything you need. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient and good value, pet-friendly”
Reviews.Author: ede19
Reviews.Content: A former Upper East Sider (72nd/Mad) back in town for a week and not able to stay at home, was looking for a reasonable pet friendly place walking distance to Central Park as I was bringing my dog. The Franklin turned out to be the right choice. While as everyone else has said, the rooms are VERY small (and I had bookied a Superior Queen but not sure if it was really any bigger than the regular Queen), with a tiny bathroom with a little nook for a tiny sink barely shoulder-width, everything was very clean and felt new enough - carpets, paint, sheets, etc. All clean and fresh-feeling, including in the halls. Liked the bathrobe too. All of the staff I encountered was professional, friendly and non-intrusive, and they were nice to my dog - who fortunately is a quiet, polite little pup. The morning breakfast buffet was perfect for me and I loved the self-help coffee/cappuccino machine that could be accessed all day. I looked every day for the wine/cheese in the afternoon and it never seemed to be out or maybe I always missed it. Great location - around the corner from the Lexington line. I never needed a cab. It was an easy walk to Central Park and the Met. All kinds of convenient stores and restaurants in the area. Best deal of all - every third night free, so I had two free nights over seven days which brought the average room rate down to about $300 - including misc charges and all NYC taxes which add about 20%. Guests seemed to mostly be European tourists and small business travelers. Checking out I was surprised to bump into Faye Dunaway who apparenty also stays there. Staff was appropriately discreet when I asked, but I've seen her loads of times so it was definitely her.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: dinorawk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for my conference. The room and bathroom were small, but clean. The pillows and the bed were excellent. However, the noise was awful! Not street noise, not noise from other guest rooms, or even other guests. The noise was from the staff in the lobby. 2 out of 4 nights I was woken out of a dead sleep at 3am by the staff talking and watching videos on the internet in lobby. The sound carried all the way down the hall and into my room, and when I got up, went to the lobby and asked the staff to be quiet, she asked me which guest was being loud. Incredibly unprofessional and unacceptable for an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy E
Reviews.Content: I rarely have the reason to travel without my husband or children, but this past weekend I was going to be in NYC visiting with some friends and wanted a nice, reasonably priced hotel on the upper east side where we were all getting together. Clean, and safe were my priorities and I took a chance on a hotel that looked great on the web although many comments were made about how small it was. I can't even tell you how much I enjoyed my stay, my room was beautiful (yes small, but how much room does one need in NYC) I booked a petite queen because it was just me. My bed was comfortable, the room was spotless, the ambiance was that of a European hotel and honestly I wished I could just curl up in bed, rent a movie and forget meeting my girlfriends at the restaurant for the evening. I arrived just in time for the wine, cheese and crackers that they serve nightly (free) which was a real treat after taking the train and a full day of work. It felt like a real mini vacation, and I felt decadent, pampered and just loved it. In the morning I joined the other guests in the gorgeous sitting area for the complimentary breakfast (muffins, croissant, fruit, and cereal) and had some lovely conversation with the other guests; all who seemed to be equally affected by the ambiance of our surroundings. All in all, I can't wait to have another reason to go back to this hotel and would highly recommend it especially to women traveling alone. It would be a little tight quarters for a family or even some couples but for me it was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Postage stamp sized rooms, priced too high. Someone in corporate's having a laugh.”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: The room is a "petite queen." Nice marketing line. I'm not a fan of this particular "boutique" hotel chain. Using the word "boutique" is also a bit of a marketing joke, I mean scam. The rooms aren't terrible, and it's not a hell-hole like some NY hotels. The lighting and the flowers (sometimes) are pretty and a nice touch, and it's fairly quiet. Security isn't great. It does feel more like a small (I mean SMALL) rented apartment than an actual hotel room. You'll have to work really hard to maneuver your body between the bed and the walls. Not quite as bad as their other location at Times Square, the walls aren't as thin as their location midtown East with the sour milk in the cappuccino machine. There are very, very few amenities here. Some people like the coziness, and I'm happy for those who find it adorable and serene (and in many ways it is). It just has a teeny-weeny bit of a rip-off feel (there's a marketing line for you, on the house).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: refinedperson
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay on the upper east side; however, there aren't very many hotels in that area. This is a quiet small hotel in an upscale neighborhood. The Franklin is well situated to restaurants and a short walk to the 4-5-6 subway line. It's a good location from which to get around Manhattan on the subway. Everyone knows how expensive New York taxies are! The Franklin was built in the 1920's. It is tastefully decorated and fully updated. Bathrooms are small, but immaculate and modern. The staff was very warm and professional. It does not have a restaurant or bar, but rather a small sitting room where a continental breakfast or wine is served. This is not an issue because there are many restaurants and coffee shops nearby at all price points. The Franklin reminds me of many small, family owned european hotels that I have stayed at. The lobby, elevator, rooms and baths are very, very small, but the staff is attentive. One problem occurred with a malfunctioning TV/ cable. The staff was very gracious and upgraded my room and gave me a hotel credit. Also, the air conditioner is in the window so it can click on and off at times. This was not noticable to me, but it's something to be aware of. I did NOT miss an in room mini refrigerator, or a large closet. It's a good place to stay if you won't be spending a lot of time in your hotel room and want a safe, tasteful, clean and quiet hotel in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “"Good value for this area"”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous255068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older and, therefore, does miss some of the facilities in a more modern hotel. However, the owners have done a good job of providing nice quality amenities. The room is small but is very clean. A modest breakfast is provided which is a bonus, although the selection is limited. It is in a nice part of NY to stay with many restaurants nearby. For the price, it is good value for an overnight stay. In a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cost”
Reviews.Author: ronnie63_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is European in feel; nice breakfast, nice room on the small side, interesting location, good price

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique in the UES”
Reviews.Author: ProvidenceGuy99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here out of convenience and price to be honest. I was in Manhattan attending a birthday celebration during the Fashion Week and 9/11 tenth anniversary weekend...so I wanted to steer clear of my normal hotels in Midtown. Decided to stay on the UES, close to where the person I was visiting lived, and found The Franklin via Google Maps. The website made it look flattering and I got a decent deal at $280/night. The location of this hotel if you're visiting someone on the UES is PERFECT. The hotel itself has a ton of boutique character and is unique yet comfortable. Nothing about this hotel is spacious but it has a character and charm that can't be denied.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and a little pricey but a great slice of old New York City”
Reviews.Author: NYCSPOON
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Franklin in the 90s right before I moved to New York City and it glamored me with its charm. After 10 years of living in NYC, moving overseas and returning to NYC, it was the place to stay to fall in love with NYC again. It is rather hidden away on the Upper East Side and is super convenient for taking in the museums, Central Park and "looking" at the fashionable boutiques and restaurants of Madison & 5th Avenues. Just a block from the 6 train, really easy to get around the city from here. The rooms are small, a bit rustic, the bathrooms (in the rooms I've stayed) barely bigger than a closet. BUT if you want to feel and experience old NYC, a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here several times in past and still love it!”
Reviews.Author: Diane S
Reviews.Content: The Franklin is a very small (50 rooms) European style hotel. It is located on the Upper East Side at 87th Street between Lexington and 3rd. We love the location because it is very close to where our daughters live. However, in general I think it is a great location. There are lots of nice restaurants, shopping, and coffee shops nearby. There is also terrific shopping and you can walk to Central Park, The Met and many other great museums. The rooms are small (but in NYC you have no need to stay in the room) but extremely comfortable. We try to book the largest room which has a king size bed. The beds are very comfortable, the hotel is quiet and the staff is very nice and they respond quickly to any requests or problems. The price of the room includes a continental style breakfast which includes: cheese, French bread, pastries, yogurt, cereal, juices and coffee. They also have a machine available all day to make your own coffee, tea, hot chocolate, etc. Everyday at 5 they also have a complimentary wine and cheese hour. The hotel also provides free passes to the New York Sports Club right around the corner on 86th. The hotel lobby is small but homey and it is interesting to meet some of the other guests. Many of the guests are from abroad. Another perk is that the hotel provides Bulgari toiletries. However, one of the best things to know about this hotel is that for every 2 nights you stay, you get the 3rd night free. You need to ask about this when you call because they do not necessarily mention it. Hotels in NYC are quite pricey but this one with this special deal averages out to a very reasonable nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect, cannot WAIT to stay again”
Reviews.Author: kalegna
Reviews.Content: The Franklin is an outstanding boutique hotel. Yes, the rooms are small but if you're in NYC for the rooms, you're not doing it right...I'm just saying. The rooms are very nicely decorated. They have large nice flatscreens, a small closet with full-length mirror, especially nice bedding with an angora throw. The bathroom is the cleanest I've ever seen...literally...ever. And I know cleanliness. The miniature Bvlgari (spelling? sorry) shampoo, conditioner, and lotion is FAN-CY! They have a wonderfully healthy FREE breakfast including cereal, milk, fruit, yogurt, cheese, breads with jams, croissants, capaccino, latte, assorted high-end teas and coffees. Plus, every evening they offer a free Wine and Cheese reception for the guests. The location can't be beat. It's on a residential street and you cannot hear a peep of street noise. 1 block from the subway (4, 5,6) and necessities like drug stores and coffee shops are right next door. Oh, and they offer the assorted coffees (lattes, capaccino's, americano, regular, decaf) 24/7 in the reception area for FREE. I've stayed in several NYC hotels, all nice enough but The Franklin is my new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a NO! Depressing!”
Reviews.Author: houselinker2011
Reviews.Content: Petit Room size: 10x15 feet!!! No closets or chests to store your clothes...very old carpet that knew better days....sink is outside the tiny ancient bathroom...Very boring location with not great restaurants...the constant noise of the window A/C unit will drive you crazy...tiny dark lobby with 1 lift...my rating is 2 1/2 stars. Please invest another $50 per night and get yourself a decent place....After all you are in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jowelsh
Reviews.Content: As all reviewers have noted, the rooms are miniscule at this place. Quality decor and comfy bed/linens. No place to put the luggage and very limited hanging space for clothes (closet is about 6 inches in depth and protrudes from the wall behind the entry door). The bathroom sink with mirror was in the room at the foot of the bed. The bathroom itself had room for a toilet and a short bathtub that's it. Water pressure was OK but there was a rain showerhead which in my opinion weakens the flow. No ironing board or iron (wouldn't fit anywhere). Overall, if you're desperate to stay in the upper east side (I was, since my daughter lives in the neighborhood), then there are few options and all are expensive. This place is nice, staff is good, food is OK (ran out a few times, coffee machine broke down, etc). We got a deal from their website which made the cost a bit more reasonable but still it was more than I paid for a similar hotel with bigger rooms on the upper west side last year. I certainly wouldn't pay full price for a stay here, and am not even sure I would go back at the discounted price. Still looking for alternatives!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shepgav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Franklin for 5 nights to celebrate an anniversary and had a fantastic time. The hotel is small but everything about it is top class. The rooms are compact but quite luxurious, modern, very clean and quiet. Breakfast is continental with cereals,muffins,coissants and fruit and you can just help yourself. The coffee machine is great as is the wine and cheese offered in the afternoon. The location is brilliant with a subway entrance just around the corner so you can even get to JFK airport easily taking the airtrain ( about 1 hour ). Staff were friendly and helpful, especially the housekeeping. Wouldn,t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKcop
Reviews.Content: This is a small and cosy hotel. The staff was welcoming and smiling, the bed was amazing, the address in Upper east - I guess that's an individual thing (I prefer to be situated on the lower manhattan), but it's new york city .. use the Subway. stayed in room 42, going on to the street - no real noise to speak of.. great! and no overwhelming view either.. :/ With all the positive words I have to say, I must mention that I got this for $130 a day at quickbook. If I'd had to pay total price I'd gone somewhere else :)

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel has a lot going for it.”
Reviews.Author: Uplyme
Reviews.Content: My room at the Franklin Hotel was comfortable and attractive. There is no view to speak of, but I had a great nights sleep. The staff was accommodating. On the downside, the Upper East Side is quite far from some places a tourist might want to go to such as Broadway theatres and some museums. The Metropolitan museum is only a short distance away, however. I'd booked this online and the amount I paid was supposed to cover everything (except meals, minibar, etc.). When I got my credit card bill, I saw that the hotel had charged $15.50 for additional taxes. I'm not sure if this was the hotel's fault or the booking site's. I probably won't stay here again because of this and the fact I like to stay further downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelculture123
Reviews.Content: Located a block away from the subway in a pleasant neighborhood, the location is excellent. Can walk to many museums. Staff friendly and helpful and seemed to care about your experience. Room was small but completely quiet with nice shower. Climate control system worked well. Breakfast adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A little changed since last visit....”
Reviews.Author: malbev
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed and found both the service and quality of staf being excellent, some disappointment this time in not the same welcome at reception; being disinterested and un-enthuasiastic. The previously excellent breakfast and everning wine/cheese reception being replaced with self serve and plastic plates and knives and forks. Not good on presentation or from a 'green' point of view. The previously fine selection of cheese's {as is still advertised] being reduced to plastic covered soft cheeses...... Evening reception with other guests is still a highlight and a great way to share experiences of the day with fellow hotel guests. The rooms [which everyone agrees are small and some very tiny] are nevertheless very clean and modern. And location is excellent for Upper East Side and indeed for central New York [and great to walk in Central Park which is very nearby] In conclusion hoping our little disappointments are just a blip rather than being the norm....as others have said it can be a truly great place to stay in New York

Reviews.Title: “My favorite boutique hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGirlLB
Reviews.Content: I almost don't want to give away the secret! I love this little place so much. The rooms are small (some tiny), very European. However, the charm outweighs the cons for me. Absolutely lovely sitting room off the lobby - great place to meet friends, and the wine and cheese in the evenings is a great touch. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the upper east side.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay was ruined at the end”
Reviews.Author: sbg18
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much. Tiny lobby, small rooms, but charming and clean. Comfortable bed and good shower (minuscule sink). Excellent service. Little luxuries like European-style continental breakfast, all-day cappuccino maker, wine & cheese reception in the afternoon. I prepaid through Hotels.com. However, when I checked out, i was told there was a $12/day "service charge" for all those little luxuries. Front Desk staff told me I'd have to go back to Hotels.com to arrange for a refund. Left quite a bad taste in my mouth as I left. Not sure if I'll go back. There's nothing worse than hidden fees. For $350/night, you'd think they could spot me a cup of cappuccino each night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hideaway....a great base for exploring the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: jobunn
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel; small, warm, friendly. Great breakfast - included in the room rate. 24hr coffee/tea in the breakfast lounge. Rooms small and lacking in storage for luggage but very clean (and I am very picky about such things!), everything you need, a very good nights sleep - and we stayed for 4 and slept brililantly the whole time. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again. Perfect for seeing the musuems...central park...and feels like a bit of peace from the hectic areas like Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T EVEN SEE A ROOM”
Reviews.Author: Cpasjuste
Reviews.Content: I went into the tiny dark lobby and asked if I could see a room. The person at the front desk was unfriendly and said the hotel was booked . I couldn't visit any room out of 50 ! The only place I could see was in the back. I was directed to see the back's tiny dark living room.The breakfast room was tiny and dark as well. The person at the front desk seemed annoyed with my questions told me they didn't have 2 beds in one room. I was inquiring for my brother and his son who are coming this summer and the person answered they would have to sleep in the same bed for $250 a night ! I had been talking to my sister from France on the phone and we both had such a different idea of the hotel from the website, I just wanted to let people know that this place is not what it appears to be!......

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: fsu2001
Reviews.Content: The regular room at the Franklin is a bit on the small side, but very clean. The bathroom was clean with Bulgari products, which was very nice. The bed was comfortable and the service was good. Breakfast was served European style and you can stop by anytime to grab a cup of coffee. Overall, a good visit and experience!

Reviews.Title: “The quaintest hotel I've ever fallen in love with!”
Reviews.Author: valleegirl22
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for my 25th birthday this year. Wanted to celebrate a milestone in a big city so I after searching the area I wanted to be in, I found a good rate for this hotel. After reading some other reviews I decided it ranked the best one for the price. I was really nervous since this was my first time to the big apple. The hotel was right in the middle of everything! I was so excited. When I arrived, the bellman was quick and polite. The front desk help was awesome. The elevator was old (right out of a movie), cool to experience it. My room was small but so perfect for me. With the windows closed, you couldn't hear any outside noise which was a plus but wouldn't have been a killer since I was there to experience the city. It was modern, completely chic and clean! The shower was hot and the robe/slippers provided by the hotel just 'glammed' it even more. The sheets, comforter and towels were all plush. Honestly, I almost took the overlay-blanket home it was so comfortable and cozy. This hotel room was just as nice as any suites I've stayed at in Vegas. Location was perfect, hotel staff was great and I will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: aidlin
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at this hotel and loved it. We had read the reviews and were aware that the rooms were on the small side but then who stays in their room in New York. The bed was so so comfortable and we slept like babies. Behind the small lobby were 2 very welcoming rooms where guests could enjoy a continental breakfast. More than adequate and so friendly chatting to other visitors. The coffee machine was available 24/7 and if by chance if you returned to the hotel around 6ish cheese and wine was freely available. Very civilised!! The staff were so helpful and in particular Daphne was incredibly friendly and couldnt do enough for us. We used the subway which was just around the corner and had no problems getting about and so cheap. We have decided never to go to one of the big hotels in the hussel and bussel but to return here everytime. Fantastic and thankyou guys we will see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Check before you arrive..........”
Reviews.Author: HG001London
Reviews.Content: that you do not have one of the rooms with the sink in the tiny tiny bedroom. I cried when i saw the size of the room and i am from europe so used to small rooms. I checked the fire map and it showed that we had the worst and only room on the floor with the bathroom set up like that.(Sadly and ironically i feel we were put in this room as we looked so happy in the lobby and arriving that we would never dare complain as we were too polite-and we didn't at the time as i hate confrontation) t I felt so sorry for the porter he was obviously used to people 's reactions when getting this room as he opened the door saying "please remember before u look in that rooms in nyc are small" then he sighed moved aside and the second we (just!) managed to shut the door in the room i began to cry. i cant remember the rates we paid but if you are paying 300+ a night please do check first, this was quite a while ago o paid less but still anything over 150 for a room like that is just ridiculous. but have just been promted to write this as am about to return to NYC The actual hotel was very pretty and the furnishings in the room were gorgeous. if the sink had of been in the bathroom i could have lived with the size of room. It actually turned out to be quite funny by the end of the trip but i wouldn't want others to have the same shcok!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, great beds”
Reviews.Author: CSignes
Reviews.Content: Our stay in New York was business nor pleasure, but the result of an emergency surgery. My husband was allowed to recuperate outside of the hospital. The Franklin Hotel staff were kind and helpful; the bed was wonderfully comfortable; the room, though admittedly not large, was lovely, clean and comfortable. Great location, Upper East Side just off Lexington. Those looking for a lovely, clean and unique hotel will definitely not be disappointed; we certainly were not!

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: koganfamily
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 6 night business stay in the Franklin. It was the best experience, bar none, I've ever had in a boutique hotel. The room was small but large enough for me to do yoga every morning, and it was stunningly designed. Every detail is something I would have wanted to have in my own home, from the light fixtures to the color palette, to the bathroom fixtures to the bedding. The free breakfast was always fantastic, and the nightly wine and cheese party, also gratis, was icing on the cake. I could get a cappuccino, also gratis, at any hour, which was useful, to say the least, while I was working in my room. (The wifi, as others have mentioned, is also free.) The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The clock radio had an iPod dock. There was plenty of room for me to store my clothes and empty suitcase in the closet. The shower was divine. Also, the 6 train is literally around the corner, so getting anywhere was simple. There's a movie theater around the other corner. Great restaurants and food within short walking distance. I can't say enough fabulous things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely”
Reviews.Author: poshFiona57
Reviews.Content: Service was fine The room as said before was small, it really is. We walked every where and when tired took a taxi but it isn't central but you should know that when you book! The breakfast is great and the cheese and wine was great, there's not many hotels that will give you this service.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel - clean, friendly, quaint”
Reviews.Author: danielleflorida
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of midtown NYC. We had a great stay, which included free WiFi, complimentary breakfast (meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, juide & coffee), plus a wine & cheese party at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms extremely clean. I would definately stay here again and recommend to friends. Rate was good compared to other city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “IT worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: Onh0ls
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Franklin Hotel. Our room was nice and clean! Everything worked and it had the Bvlgari goodies in the bathroom.The staff were really all friendly and helpful when you asked for assistance. The hotel was a good location for us and is very close to catch the subway. The breakfast served was all fresh food and filled to spot, i would say it may have been better, if they changed it up each day, (a different meat or pastry) eating the same thing was getting a bit boring! There are many small restuarants, take-outs and delis in the area for lunch and dinner, and the free Wi-fI was great. The Franklin Hotel met all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: Adricons
Reviews.Content: Strange hotel. Nice touches like new bathrooms, pretty room number signs and some other quirky detials. Negatives were that the rooms are tiny. Aircon is very very noisy, no views. Most of the staff were friendly except for daytime Asian girl who did not care about our complaint about not haveing our room serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Too small for comfort”
Reviews.Author: Notpleased01
Reviews.Content: Had booked six night stay but left after one. Had the largest room , but: no place to put luggage, limited draw and closet space, tiny bathroom, but worst of all there was little space to move around since bed took up probably 80% of room. On the plus side was a great location and splendid staff, but none of this could make up for the limited space.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: rhprice
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small as others have said. Be prepared to park your own car, there is no valet parking. I wished that had been mentioned before we arrived. Also, there is a $12 service charge, also not mentioned except on the bill. When I asked what it was for I was given the run around. Oh, its for things other hotels charge for like internet access, I was told. Why not mention it up front. And, friendly staff? I think not. The lady of the front desk made us feel we were lucky to be staying here. That, aside, it is as advertised

Reviews.Title: “The Franklin for a relaxing romantic holiday”
Reviews.Author: karlsson_53
Reviews.Content: Spent four fantastic nights at The Franklin... ...nothing else to say, just wonderful, thank You! Lars and Tina Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Small Room; Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rexoraslyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during business meetings so I wasn't looking for any frills. The hotel met my needs. Although they were not able to get me in before the 3pm check-in time, the staff was generally helpful. The doorman was even able to track down a taxi during morning rush hour. The room was small with limited space for clothes and bathroom items. I had some difficulty getting the room temperature to be OK but that was the only issue. Location was great for my meetings.

Reviews.Title: “An upper east side hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: plans4
Reviews.Content: A friendly, helpful staff makes sure you feel comfortable at The Franklin. Rooms are small, but very clean. Wonderful linens and the housekeeping staff made sure the room was pristine everyday. The Superior Queen Room had a very small bathroom (although clean), so I would recommend upgrading to the Deluxe Queen, or Executive King room instead. This was our second stay at The Franklin......but not our last.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: juicy1016lucy
Reviews.Content: The doormen and the welcoming clerk behind the desk, were all very helpful and friendly. I also loved the shower in my room, the bed, and the fact that I asked about having a quiet room when I made my reservations and you gave me a room in the back. They actually listened to me! Good breakfasts, too.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, friendly boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RossnSarah
Reviews.Content: Trapped by the ash and stayed at Franklin on recommendation of a friend who lives a couple of blocks away. I chose a small room and that was what I got. No problem. It was clean, tidy, nicely decorated with a comfortable bed with quality linen. Given that I was out enjoying the charms of the city, the hotel room was ideal and I had a very comfortable night's sleep. The door man gave me a warm greeting which was followed by the front desk staff. I would definitely stay again and in fact look foward to it. The Franklin makes a refreshing change to the large branded hotels

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Garloo
Reviews.Content: Our son just moved to the Upper East Side and we chose The Franklin for a recent long weekend visit because it is very convenient to his apartment. It was our first visit to NYC in many years. We had a great weekend and The Franklin played no small part. Tiny room, but well-appointed with a very comfortable bed. But who goes to New York to sit in a hotel room anyway? Subway stop right around the block. Interesting continental breakfast including prosciutto, cheese, crusty bread and croissants. But what really makes The Franklin a standout is the friendly, helpful and responsive staff. Everyone made us feel welcome and right at home. It was the kind of personal service that you don't get at the big chain hotels. We are already looking forward to our next visit to New York and The Franklin.

Reviews.Title: “European Charm on the UES”
Reviews.Author: C&Rsobe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it was close to appointments and I like the UES. I had a petite queen which was fine for one person, though not two. The Superior Q or K would be better. that being said, the bed was soooo comfortable I didn't want to get up. Staff is lovely, Doorman always there, Place is very clean and very quiet. One block to the 6 subway, cabs are plentiful on Lex and Third. Lots of food choices and exploring in neighborhood. Looking forward to next visit

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chic, great Upper East Side location”
Reviews.Author: coloradogirl05
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Franklin for three nights. Got a great deal, they were offering a "stay three nights, get one free". Still had to pay taxes on that third night..but oh well. The location can't be beat if you want to be on the UES. The subway is at 87th and lex....about a block away. The main reason we chose this hotel was the location, I have a sister that lives on 77th and york, so this was within walking distance to her. It was so nice getting away for the craziness of midtown. Cute breakfast, loved the wine and cheese in the evening. Smmmalllll room but it's NYC...it's whats expected. The elevator just tops off the old world charm but it was so nice having modern amenities. I would totally return the next time I'm there. Too bad they didn't have a hot tub somewhere squeezed in there...could have used it after all that walking! :)

Reviews.Title: “Truly a boutique hotel, despite the small room”
Reviews.Author: RATHKE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pleasantly surprised when we pulled our car up to the entrance of the Franklin Hotel on the Upper East Side of NY. I chose this hotel because it was close to our children who live in Harlem and close to the subway. It was an alternative to a Marriott in the same area. In addition they offered a "stay 2 nights, get the 3rd night free". Although I had read reviews that the rooms were small my husband suggested that I call to make sure that the petite queen had a closet. I was told that the petite queen room had NO closets. When I was hesitant about keeping the reservations I was first upgraded to a super queen and then a deluxe queen with no additional charge. I was quite happy with that solution. We found the room very small but adequate, although the only bureau was a night table. We took the phone books out of the drawer and shared the 3 small drawers for the 2 of us. There was a small closet, with ironing board and iron, safe and umbrella! The light bulb in the closet out and I neglected to report it. The TV did not work the first night and we were told the IT man was supposed to come but apparently had not. We were not satisfied with that but were told he would be coming. We woke up the next AM pleased to find the big screen flat TV on the wall was working! The room was very hot each night and we could not find a thermostat. We slept with an open window which solved the problem but we felt it wasn't energy efficient & the person sleeping next to the window was a bit cold. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. There were plenty of snacks and drinks to purchase from the top of the desk. There was a wine and cheese gathering each evening in a delightful small dining area and each morning there was a delicious continental breakfast of croissants, bread, cheese and meat, jams, granola, milk, yogurt, juice and an espresso/latte machine in addition to regular coffee and tea. There was an adjoining comfortable sitting room with current newspapers. The rooms as well as the the dining and sitting area were tastefully decorated in a brown and blue motif with beautiful silk wall paper. There were lovely fresh flower arrangements in both rooms and lovely roses at the front desk. In addition each floor had delightful mosaic tile framed pictures on the wall and each room number with mosaic tiled. The hotel is pet friendly and one of the staff had her little dog there. He was sweet but did have an accident which they attended to. The staff was really helpful with our luggage and sweet with getting us into and out of the "old fashioned" elevator. All in all a delightful experience. The location, amenities, and friendly staff were a plus despite the small, hot room.

Reviews.Title: “sardine can”
Reviews.Author: dstreep
Reviews.Content: they put me in room 53...said it was a deluxe queen and that it was roomier than most. OMG...I'd say maybe 100sq ft and if you include the bathroom 110 sqft. low water pressure, an A/C that needed to be on because the room was so hot(in December) and it rattled all night. Cold cofee in the AM and a doorman who was never near the door...AAA rate was over $300...AVOID this place if you are over 5'10"

Reviews.Title: “Absoutely Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: WongaDeWildWuman
Reviews.Content: I Am HONORED To Write A Review On The Franklin Hotel !!! I MUST Give A HUGE Thank You To Showkat And Francelle, They Added An EXTRA Plus On The A++++++ That I Am Giving The Franklin Hotel !!! From The Moment That We Arrived On The Door Step, To The Moment We Checked Out... EVERYTHING Was PERFECT !!! I Arranged For A ROMANTIC Get-Away For My Husband And My 26TH Wedding Anniversary, And I Could NOT Have Picked A BETTER Place !!! From The Quaint Sitting Area, To The 24 Hour Cafe'... We BOTH Loved It ALL !!! The Complimentary Breakfast Was WONDERFUL, EVERYTHING Was Delicious... And SO FRESH !!! And I Must Say How AMAZING The Wine In The Evening Was, It Was Such A WONDERFUL Way To Wind Down Our Hectic Days... PERFECT !!! I Have To Say That I Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND The Franklin Hotel To EVERYONE !!! We Will DEFINITELY Be Staying At The Franklin Hotel AGAIN, I Will NOT Even Look Elsewhere... I Have Found The PERFECT Place For US !!! Again, THANK YOU Showkat And Francelle... WE HAD AN AMAZING STAY AT THE FRANKLIN HOTEL, And The Two Of YOU Desreve KUDOS !!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Felt like you were at home!”
Reviews.Author: karlacinapri
Reviews.Content: We just finished a three night stay at this hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful and the extra amenities were definitely a plus. The subway was around the corner and we were able to get from one end of Manhattan to the other with ease. The area around the hotel had wonderful shops, resturants and fruit stands. I have never stayed at such a wonderful place in NYC and would recommend this place to almost anyone. The rooms are small but very clean with great décor. It truly had the feel of a European bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “yes, the room was tiny, but ...”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaChic
Reviews.Content: Yes, our room at The Franklin Hotel was tiny! We had the basic queen room and the space was sufficient for us two and our stuff for a two night stay. Our room and the public areas were clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The view from our window was a brick wall with a glimpse of the sky to the side - but we weren’t there for the view. We did have a full view of the street from the front parlor where we enjoyed breakfast and afternoon wine. I loved the breakfast of fresh (not frozen!) pastries, yogurt, and coffee drinks. I also liked the old-time elevator with a door we had to open ourselves. I found charming the worn down “Lobby” button in the elevator. The location was great for us - within walking distance of the Guggenheim (our reason for visiting) and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. We would recommend The Franklin for travelers who want to stay on the upper east side, but not for those who want to be closer to the more popular tourist sites and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not for people allergic to pets”
Reviews.Author: Gigis_mum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in late August and loved everything about the hotel - well, almost everything. The bed was the most comfortable in the world and the pillows were excellent quality . The bathroom was very clean. The breakfast of fresh baguettes and French pastries, prosciutto, jam, cereal, yogurt, juices and coffee bar was fantastic (a little fruit would've made it perfect). The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The free WIFI was a classy touch. The location was perfect: 1 block from subway lines 4,5,6; many buses; shopping around the corner; Jamba Juice; Best Buy; Barnes & Noble; a pharmacy; the Metropolitan Museum of Art within walking distance; a movie theater around the corner; and an excellent French restaurant, Cafe d'Alsace, about 3 blocks away. The hotel often has specials which can be found on their website, like the "3 nights for the price of 2". What we didn't like about the hotel was the size of the rooms (tiny), the loud air conditioners (at least this blocked any possible noise from the street, elevator, hallway or adjacent rooms!) and their pet policy. We didn't know that pets were allowed and my son developed a terrible allergy during our stay. He was congested and sneezing all the time in the hotel. Thank goodness for the pharmacy across the street. Since the corridors and rooms are so small (and there is very little space between furniture and walls), it must be hard to manoeuver an industrial vacuum cleaner around the hotel. If we go back, I'll ask if there are any rooms that are pet-free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you have to stay on the upper east side”
Reviews.Author: lawmom555
Reviews.Content: Rooms are teeny-tiny, but comfortable and clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. It is very quiet. Close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: fearlesschickgoforth
Reviews.Content: The Franklin has a lot going for it: Clean rooms, friendly staff, a good breakfast and wine and cheese in the evenings. It has free wireless. It's in a great location. The 4,5, and 6 train stop is around the corner and Central Park is only a few blocks away. The downside is the size of rooms. They are tiny. There were two of us in the room. One person placed a suitcase on the desk the other was on the floor and had to be stepped over to move around the room. The bathroom is not well ventilated. I would absolutely stay again if I were traveling alone. If I were not traveling alone I would look around for a better deal in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Franklin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littleshelley
Reviews.Content: I had a very last minute stay in NYC. My daughter had walked by this small hotel often, and called and booked a room for me the same night. They were offering a summer special, stay 2 nights, get the third free. What my daughter and I hadn't counted on: free European breakfast every morning, wine and cheese every afternoon, and outstanding service from the staff. The rooms were quite small, but fine for the time we spent in it. It was located 1 block from the 86th station, and walking distance to the park. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Upper East Side Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestovacation
Reviews.Content: Went to visit my new grand daughter in April and wanted not to stay in a crowded one bedroom apartment on the upper east side. My daughter, a long time NYC resident found this little gem one block from her apartment! There was wine and cheese every afternoon and a nice little breakfast every morning included in the price. The rooms were very small, opening the bathroom door meant losing my closet door, and the bed took up most of the room. However, it looked newly decorated and very clean. Nice staff and price for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and convenient location but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: chavi2383
Reviews.Content: On arrival I didn't expect much from the small opening off the street but the service was excellent and I was escorted to the room and given all the information regarding their services. The room was small and I think you can get a better deal elsewhere - see my other review on the Hilton Garden Inn at Times Square - but all in all I was satisfied. Located on the upper east side, there offer a complimentary gym pass to a very fine gym, complimentary breakfast, and although no room service from the hotel itself, they have a connection to a restaurant near by. It's clean and cute but unless you can find better deals.

Reviews.Title: “a favorite boutique”
Reviews.Author: Oloud
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many moderately priced NYC boutique hotels on business. This one is great if you can get a good rate and if you don't mind a very small facility (feels more like a little apt building than a hotel.) I prefer this intimate feeling and also like being on the upper east vs. crazy midtown. You'll feel like a neighborhood resident. Rooms are small but beautifully decorated and very clean. Bathrooms are very very small but fabulous Bulgari toilletries make up for it. Nice 1st floor lounge and complimentary cappuccino machine is great. Continental breakfast included is EXCELLENT- not your typical stale pastry. Homemade yogurt and granola, croissant, baguette and gourmet cheeses. Great little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, cute, cute...........”
Reviews.Author: Teresa567
Reviews.Content: We were in-town for a friend's wedding and stayed at The Franklin for 3 nights in 2/09 before heading down to stay 3 more nights on the lower east side. The hotel is located in a great spot on the upper east side very near the 86th/Lex subway stop. The hotel is walking distance to the park, the met, and places to eat/drink on 2nd ave..... It feels quieter and more residential up there than other more "touristy" areas of NYC which is so welcomed in such a crazy city. We flew in on the red-eye and got to the hotel around 9am. HUGE points for letting us check-in so early. The staff were sweet and friendly throughout our stay. The place has a bed and breakfast/home-like feel to it. We saw very few guests during our stay and felt like we lived here by the time we left. Very private and relaxing. The rooms are tiny, but very charming with soft colors, nice lighting, and great beds. Our room had a small desk, large TV, queen sized bed, and decent closet space. Expensive mini-bar (but aren't they always?)....do wish they had offered free water though. Wireless internet service was great as was daily newspaper delivery. We were on the 7th floor and maid service came late (around 2pm), but we are not "morning" people so this didn't bother us a bit. The bathroom is really small and the water pressure on the rain shower a little weak, but other than that, they did a great job with the space. The breakfast area is small, but cozy. Don't expect a full on American breakfast, but the rolls, cereal, coffees, and tea are a great addition to the place. I loved the textured wall paper...might have to add some to my dining area back home. We also enjoyed the free evening wine and cheese further adding to the romantic, charming feel of the hotel. The coffee machine runs 24/7 so you can always pop in and get yourself a latte and tea.....which is so nice on the chilly winter Manhattan nights. Really a great boutique hotel worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Well presented but small”
Reviews.Author: Banjoburger
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a base for our first visit to New York along with a number of friends. Initially I was very disappointed with the size of our room. In truth there was very little space bar a path around the bed and with two large bags most of the floor was gone. Not much storage space either for clothes but I suppose that's to be expected of a small hotel like this. The room was very clean and well presented and the toilet/shower room (the wash basin was in the bedroom rather than the bathroom) was well maintained. Having said all this some of the other couples in our group did get rooms that were much larger so there was an element of luck involved. There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel but there are plenty of alternatives in the surrounding area and the hotel staff are very accomodating if you want to bring food/drink back in to the two rooms that are used as communal areas. Breakfast consists of cereal, various breads, ham and the usual beverages so is ample. A real selling point was the wine and cheese that was made available in the evening, especially if you are with a group. As far as location goes it was fine. Only a couple of blocks away from Central Park and the subway so it was a good staging point but it would have been quite a walk to the main attractions in Downtown Manhattan....taxis were the best solution. So in summary although I was disappointed with the size of the room and the lack of bar/restaurant I really can't fault the cleanliness or the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: szlwzl
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 5 night stay in this hotel and couldn't recommend it highly enough. The staff were brilliant and couldn't have been more helpful. The rooms are as small as you'd expect for a manhattan hotel but the ground floor communal areas make up for it. The free breakfast and free wine and cheese in the evening are a definite bonus and we will be definitely using this hotel again in the future. One thing to be aware of is that you will have to pay state and service taxes at the end of your stay, this amounted to a further $79 for 5 nights which isn't too bad but is something to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “compact & cozy”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: I am really impressed with the other reviews of this property. They pretty much hit the mark. Don't be put off by the somewhat garrish apearance of the red marquee with some missing letters which give the look of a "No-tell Motel". This is a well maintained property, with a courteous and efficient staff. The rooms are compact but comfortable, though the bathrooms are rather a bit too "abbreviated", read very small. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were very fresh. The AC was working in Oct!!! however, it was not silent when cycling on and off. Other than this, my room was quiet. The breakfasts consist of small and unvaried selection pastries, crusty bread, cheese, prosciutto, granola and good coffee. The addition of some fresh fuit would be very nice. The location is convenient for Met Museum visits, the Neue Galerie, and the Guggenheim Museum, etc. The metro station is just around the corner on Lexington. My family lives in the neighborhood, so I will probably stay at the Franklin in the future if I come alone; though, I think my husband might find the rooms too compact for his comfort. However, dear traveler, be aware that there is a "sevice charge" added to your bill. When I asked about this, I was told it was for ... basically the amenities - the NY Times every morning, the internet access, the breakfasts, the robes, slippers, toiletries, etc. Nope, there's no "free" lunch Virginia! Let's have some truth in advertising, please.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at The Lincoln”
Reviews.Author: BerryK
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend was a NYC resident for sometime so he acted as my tour guide and picked this hotel based on it's location for my first visit to NYC. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at The Franklin. It definitely exceeded our expectations. The room was very small (which we had expected; c'mon it's New York!), however everything within the room was exceptionally nice. The bed and linens were comfy and clean. There was a nice sized flat-screen t.v. and the bedside alarm had an iPod port. The bath was also small, but again everything was VERY clean, nice and worked properly. It seemed also pretty insulated as I never heard our neighbors. It was very close to the subway and there were some tasty restaurants nearby which made it very convenient. The staff was really helpful and kind too. Overall, I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: dotbrit
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome, told we had been upgraded but even so the room was very small and the bathroom even smaller (no room to lift your arms when using the wash basin). The room was so small that the heat from the flat screen tv on the wall made the room hot and the air conditioning was inadequate. The air conditioning was also just a box let into the window and was very noisy. The whole feel of this hotel was claustrophobic

Reviews.Title: “Little Franklin not bad”
Reviews.Author: MarylandDani
Reviews.Content: It is amazing how accurate other reviewers described this hotel. Practically everything everybody said is correct. We had a "Deluxe" Queen, and I would not be able to stand it in anything smaller. I could barely get to the sink and I am a size four. The closet door did open though not all the way because of the desk and there was of course no dresser, though the single night table did have 3 small drawers. But the mattress was very good and we could actually move around the room. The air conditioner cycled on and off a whole night. But, the room was spic and span clean and looked recently renovated. The staff was very friendly, the breakfast was very adequate (though I would suggest some healthier option like fruit instead of some of the carbohydrate loaded fare). The area is great; so close to the park, the subway, the Metropolitan, etc, etc. Having said all that, I have stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Upper East Side on 92nd St and eventhough the area is just a tiny bit less perfect, the rooms are larger, the bed is larger, the bathroom is larger, parking is easier, internet access is better in the lobby , there is a coffee maker and a chair in the room as well as a dresser, and everything is clean too and it is cheaper. One would have to get breakfast somewhere else and do without wine and cheese at 5, not the end of the world. I did have a bit of a problem with the reservations; I tried to cancel them since I found a better deal somewhere else and although the web says cancellations accepted one day before, and the receipt emailed stated the same, when I called they said cancellations had to be made before 3 PM. So beware of this policy, since it's not clear. All in all, it's a really nice quaint little place.Not for claustrophobics

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: swansu
Reviews.Content: We found this wonderful hotel by reading reviews on Trip Advisor which led us to Expedia. The hotel was wonderful for us in every way. It has a very European feel to it. Whoever owns or manages this hotel takes a lot of pride in what they're doing. First, the room was immaculate. The bed and sheets were high quality and super comfortable. Our room was situated in a way that we heard no outside noise from other guests or elevator. We had a superior queen which was not too small by NYC standards. The breakfast was lovely in every way. It was a nice way to start the day before heading out to see the sights. The food was very fresh and they took a lot of care with it. We also enjoyed the evening wine & cheese. Again, done very nicely. The people that work at this hotel get an A plus in my book. They were so friendly and always wanting to assist us in any way they could. You never felt like you were bothering them. The location....we loved it. 3 blocks over to Central Park and the Met. Subway was right around the corner. We will stay here again the next time we come to NYC. This is the first time I have ever taken the time to write a review and we travel a lot. It's so refreshing to go to a hotel that takes pride in what they're doing. It is a boutique hotel so if you like big Marriotts, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Xtaltips
Reviews.Content: Always amusing to come back and read reviews after having visited a hotel. On reflection I think that most of the reviews of this hotel are pretty accurate except for the the one who seemed determined to complain about everything and expected to be treated like royalty! Yes - the rooms are small but beautifully appointed. Yes - the dining area is also small but the breakfast is great. The intimate wine and cheese tasting in the evening is an unexpected bonus. We met another couple and went out for dinner on the strength of having a laugh over a few glasses at The Franklin. Also - the desk staff were extremely helpful and obliging. Overall - I defy anyone to find this standard of hotel in Manhattan for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great deal but for light travelers”
Reviews.Author: Just_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been many times to NYC and my experience in The Franklin was one of the best. It is a cute classic building but rooms are completely remodeled in a very modern way. Bed, bathroom & amenities are fantastic! Breakfast is good and staff is really amaiable. It's location could not be better: one block from a subway station ( where you can take two express lines and one regular one ) and about four blocks from the Met. Great selection of stores in the surrounding blocks. Just one catch, the small queen rooms have no closet ! It only has a very small space for 3 - 4 hangers tops. If you are a light traveler, single traveler, or don't mind having your clothes inside your bags, this is a really great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: pooley123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Franklin and I can't say a poor word about the hotel, it was a wonderful experience. Our room was beautiful and incredibly sheik. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the plasma screen tv was a real treat. The room was luxurious, complete with a ihome alarm clock and ipod charger, a beautiful cashmere throw, window seat, desk, beautiful chanderlier on a dimmer, and a full length mirror. An iron, hair dryer, umbrella, robe, and designer toiletries were all included. Our room faced the street and it got a bit noisey in the mornings but it's NYC so what else could you expect? It was certainly not an issue. The only thing I wish the room had was a mini fridge. The room size was also not an issue, it was a King (upgraded for free w/o even asking) size room and had plenty of space and a lovely bathroom. Nothing is overly big but not awkward either, again it's NYC and I didn't go there to lounge around in my room for days on end. Overall I'd say it was one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever been in for the price and probably closer to a 4*. The staff was pretty friendly, and actually very normal and not the overly perky, annoyingly fake type. The were very eager to help and always polite and jovial. The doorman is delightful as well. The location of The Franklin is a dream as far as I'm concerned, it's right in hub on Manhattan's wealthiest neighbourhood, 3 blocks from Central Park and the Guggenheim, two seconds from the subway and within walking distance to all the best shops on the Upper East Side. Also we booked a hop-on bus tour and it stopped right in front of the Guggenheim as well. I couldn't have asked for a better location especially if you're after the museums, Madison Avenue shops, and the Park. Just east of the Franklin is a plethora of restuarants where you'll find something for every pallate and budget. The hotel has some real perks too. The continental breakfas was awesome - chesses, pastries, the most amazing crusty bread, proscuttio, cereal, juices, and the fantastic cappucino maker. It was a delight and was all I needed to start my day. For the record I never saw the buffet run out of food, nor did we ever have any trouble finding a place to sit and eat. We only made it to the wine and cheese once but again such a great experience - delicious cheeses, crackers, and lots of free wine. Fantastic. The hotel is equipped with wireless internet and there is a complimentary computer in the lobby for guests as well. I never had any problems getting time on the computer and I believe the hotel was booked to capacity. The only reason I would stay anywhere else in NYC is b/c I do enjoy a variety but it would be pretty difficult for me to find something that would make me switch the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Darg0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tiny. We booked a superior queen and without knowing it were upgraded to a Deluxe King. Even that room was ridiculously small. Take a look at the pictures on their website. The photographer has done wonders making it look bigger than it feels. There is not enough room to leave your case open apart from on the bed. There is no choice but to unpack into the wardrobe. I wanted to use the supplied ironing board and could only do so in the bathroom. I have never stayed in a place so small even as a single in a bed and breakfast. The room was booked as a double but was only supplied for a single person. One set of towels, one glass, one robe, etc. We had to ask for a second set of towels etc. and only got exactly what we asked for 1 large, 1 small towel, no face cloth and none of the extra accoutrements. Breakfast was nice if you don't mind eating in a hallway. They had fresh fruit, pastries and cereals, though I was told they ran out soon after we left for the day, the food was good. There was a mess up on the second day and the room wasn't cleaned. I guess a prankster turned over the please tidy my room sign. Did we get an apology? NO. Nothing, a single set of towels when we asked for clean. The others were still wet on the unmade bed. The next day I expected an apologetic clerk, an offer of discount off our next stay or a voucher for lunch at a local restaurant. I've stayed at a lot of hotels that try to look after the clientele, most offer something when a mistake has been made. This place, nothing. I will not be going back and I don't advise you to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a couple reservations”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler48
Reviews.Content: After seeing reviews here, we booked for 5 nights. We've stayed in Greenwich, Midtown, now wanted a different feel. Loved the location--1 block to subway--and the boutique-ness of the hotel. We booked petite queen but certain we got a king--fabulous! Bath very nicely appointed as is the entire hotel. Our room faced the street--pros and cons of nice light and street view along with garbage noise @ 7:30 a.m. What I loved was the continental breakfast and the evening wine and cheese. BUT they ran out of most items nearly every day for both events--well before the ending times. That definitely could use much more attention. The staff would respond by looking for croissants or crackers only to say they were out. Overall, the staff was friendly and attentive with one reservation. We arrived in NYC late and asked for nearby dinner rec, the doorman walked us to Bella Cucina across the street--definitely the worst meal we would have the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'm mixed. Lovely in many ways. For the right people, a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: epilogue
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that had a cool atmosphere and was reasonably priced and was on the upper East Side. The Franklin seemed to fit all the criteria. Their website wasn't working when I booked, so I called. I specifically asked the man I spoke with if they had valet parking and he said yes, even quoted a price for it! I knew the rooms were small so ordered the King Deluxe, and went down with my daughter for a 3-day stay. When we got there, a very friendly doorman said, "no, no valet." But pointed me across the street to self-park. Okay, weird mix-up. I hoped for the best. Inside, a pleasant-enough desk clerk checked us in. The hotel was built around 1920, I believe, and has a lot of charm. There are two small but nicely laid-out public rooms--a front parlor and a rear area with tables and chairs. (More later). The EXTREMELY friendly doorman brought us up to our room in the old-fashioned elevator. Elevator door opened to claustrophobia-inducing, narrow, low-ceilinged corridors. "You have the largest room in the house," he said. That made me happy but when he opened the door to our room, I almost laughed. I've stayed in tiny rooms in NY before, but this one took the prize. HOWEVER, it was spotlessly clean. The linens on the King bed were pristine and gorgeous. The bathroom was teensy, but again, clean. Nice amenities. No fridge. Bright (we faced the street). Couldn't open the closet door fully because it hit the bed. Morning was best at this hotel. The complimentary continental breakfast they serve is really wonderful. First of all, they have a great machine that makes quite good espressos and cappucinos and such. For a spread, they had prosciutto, good french bread slices, good jam. Sliced fruit. Mini croissants that were flaky and fresh, not hard out of some bag. Pleasant tables to sit at, either in the rear room or the front parlor. Good selection of newspapers. They did a stand-up job in this department. (I believe they also serve wines and cheese at cocktail hour). I think if this hotel had been in a more central area, or closer to the park, or if there hadn't been two of us in the room, we would have been fine with it, but we realized we felt too claustrophobic and stuck in left field after all. We ended up leaving a day early and going to the Ritz on Central Park South for our last night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nina064
Reviews.Content: My husband, I, and another couple just spent 5 nights at the Franklin. We had a Petit Queen, while the other couple stayed in a King. The Petit Queen is not for large guests: ours was small with a tiny bathroom, a very small box-like cloth hanger (suitcases will crowd the floor), and a wash basin in the room rather than in the bathroom. We had small carry-ons and the room size was just fine for us. The King had very adequate space, and a much larger bathroom. The rooms were spotless, wonderfully appointed, with great beds, linens, towels, and bath products. Great flat panel TV (which we never used ... being in NYC!), and cool phone and i-home alarm. The hotel is located on a quiet street, very convenient to public transportation. Service was excellent. Breakfast was very nice, consisting of a variety of breads and sweets, cheese and excellent prosciutto. The espresso/cappuccino machine, as noted by other guests, is a hit. Late afternoons, they serve artisanal cheeses and wine, a great touch and actually very useful when walking all over town during the day and wanting to relax for a couple of hours before going out in the evenings. The hotel has a nice sitting/reading room, the rooms have fine bath robes and slippers for people who want some relaxation. If I were to go to NYC for a work trip, this would be a top place to consider, mostly because it has a very nice and relaxing environment. As a tourist who wants to make the most of NYC, it is almost a pity not to take advantage of these perks and spend a couple of hours a days just hanging around this charming hotel. This has been one of the best hotel experiences we have had so far.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely impressed with The Franklin”
Reviews.Author: bluenewsome
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak highly enough about our stay. The staff was so friendly and accommodating that I felt guilty if I beat them to the elevator door and opened it myself, which didn't happen often! The continental breakfast each morning was great and saved us spending the extra money at a corner Starbucks or deli before starting our day. And with breakfast hours until 10 a.m., we didn't have to get up at the break of dawn in order to enjoy it. The wine and cheese reception was a terrific amenity. After full days of walking the streets and sightseeing, we came to look forward to the reception as a way to recharge before we regrouped for nights on the town. The room was small - I would suspect that's the norm in Manhattan - but the amenities, by far, made up for that. The flat-panel TV made the most of the room's limited size. A huge TV for the room and great if you're taking a few minutes to rest your feet in bed. The plush bed, the fancy soaps and shampoos, and a spacious shower made up for any lack of space to put a suitcase. And, as a journalist, I loved getting the New York Times delivered to my room each morning and having the Wall Street Journal at breakfast. The location was prime. The 6-line on the subway is around the corner and carried us nearly everywhere we needed to go. It travels from the northernmost part of Manhattan to the Brooklyn Bridge in the south, and is one train away from going all the way to Battery Park (Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island Ferry). I loved our proximity to Central Park and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and it was fun being in a part of town where millionaires are as abundant as taxi cabs. When I booked our trip, I was considering our lodging more or less a place to catch some ZZZs before heading out again. It became much more than that and made our trip considerably more enjoyable. I've stayed nowhere else in NYC to compare, but without question I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind small, the Franklin is Fab”
Reviews.Author: blimpie71
Reviews.Content: If you are even slightly concerned about how small the rooms might be at the Franklin, I suggest you look elsewhere because they are SMALL! But...if that doesn't bother you, everything else about the Franklin is a delight. The staff is outstanding and even though we only stayed for 2 nights, we felt that they knew us, welcoming us when we came in at night and wishing us a good day when we left in the mornings. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy.
